notes: Updated the 'Update INI File' plugin step. Added option to allow users to add comments to sections. Added an option to give the user a choice between ';' and '#' for comments. Multiple comments are allowed but empty lines between comments will not be preserved.

PLUGIN_FILES.description:
HP Quality Center (QC) is a set of web-based test management software offerings from the HP Software Division of Hewlett-Packard, many of which were acquired from Mercury Interactive Corporation. HP Quality Center offers software quality assurance, including requirements management, test management and business process testing for IT and application environments.
    In order for this plugin to work with HP ALM 11 and later, you must open the web UI of HP ALM from the agent machine, click on their 'Add-ins Page' link and install the 'HP ALM Connectivity' add-in.

PLUGIN_FILES.description: A shell is a piece of software that provides an interface for users of an operating system which provides access to the services of a kernel.  Operating system shells generally fall into one of two categories: command-line and graphical. Command-line shells provide a command-line interface (CLI) to the operating system, while graphical shells provide a graphical user interface (GUI). In either category the primary purpose of the shell is to invoke or launch another program; however, shells frequently have additional capabilities such as viewing the contents of directories.

notes: Added RPX dependency and English translations
PLUGIN_FILES.description: A shell is a piece of software that provides an interface for users of an operating system which provides access to the services of a kernel.  Operating system shells generally fall into one of two categories: command-line and graphical. Command-line shells provide a command-line interface (CLI) to the operating system, while graphical shells provide a graphical user interface (GUI). In either category the primary purpose of the shell is to invoke or launch another program; however, shells frequently have additional capabilities such as viewing the contents of directories.

Fixes APAR PI40728 - Shell (with xargs) will now correctly display the arguments in the logs.

PLUGIN_FILES.description: Checkstyle is a development tool to help programmers write Java code that adheres to a coding standard. It automates the process of checking Java code to spare humans of this boring (but important) task. This makes it ideal for projects that want to enforce a coding standard.

notes: Add the ability to store artifacts in the IBM UrbanCode Deploy server. This requires UrbanCode Build 6.1.2.0 and UrbanCode Deploy 6.2.0.2.

Update the Create Component Version step to set the property that tells the IBM UrbanCode Build server that artifacts are stored in an IBM UrbanCode Deploy server. This requires UrbanCode Build 6.1.2.0 and UrbanCode Deploy 6.2.0.2.
Fix for getVersionStatus to handle versions with non-url-safe characters properly
Fix for getVersionStatus to handle versions with non-url-safe characters properly
Support encrypted input and output properties
Support property file encryption.
Make syncing of statuses between UCB/UCD fail-safe for UCB servers older than 6.1.2.2
Fix incompatibility issue with Groovy 2.4.10
Avoid terminating the step execution thread while error stream is being copied to output stream
Add the ability to specify properties in Deploy Component Version step
Use VersionCLIResource when creating version properties
Added 'Create Environment Snapshot' and 'Deploy With Snapshot' steps.
Fixed missing AuthenticationCredentials import in Upload All Artifact Sets.
Add new steps for creating and deleting auth tokens.
Add new step for invoking Buztool from a UCD agent directory.
Address a number of issues in "Create Component Version", "Add Component Version Status", and "Create Auth Token" steps.
Fixed the Approval reject scenario while "waiting for deployments" that need approval in UCD.
Added an option to fail an Upload Artifact step if either the directories do not exist or there are no artifacts in the directories.
